Class OnlineTestController

    public class OnlineTestController
extends AbstractController

    Controller class for the OnlineTest screen.
    Author:
    Lior Zucker

    • Field Detail

      • gridPane

        javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane
        GridPane for displaying the questions

    • Constructor Detail

      • OnlineTestController

        public OnlineTestController()
        Creates an instance of the OnlineTestController class. This constructor initializes the controller and sets up the display of the test information and questions. It populates various labels and text flows with the relevant information about the test and its instructions for students and lecturers. The formatting and styling of the displayed elements are also adjusted.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()
        Initializes the controller and sets up the display of the test information and questions. This method is automatically called after the FXML file has been loaded.

      • setInfo

        public void setInfo()
        Sets the information of the test and updates the display. This method populates various labels and text flows with the relevant information about the test and its instructions for students and lecturers, based on the current screen state. It also adjusts the formatting and styling of the displayed elements.

      • submitBtn

        void submitBtn​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles the action when the Submit button is clicked. This method is triggered when the Submit button is clicked by the user to submit their test. It stops the timer, calculates the time taken by the student, and prompts for confirmation. If confirmed, it updates the test status, calculates the grade, and saves the student's answers and grade. It also checks if the student is the last one to submit and locks the test if necessary. Finally, it updates the average and median grades for the test.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event triggered by clicking the Submit button.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an exception occurs during the process.

      • checkCopy

        public void checkCopy()
        Checks for copied answers among students who took the test. Compares the answers of each student to identify potential copies. pop massage at the right lecturer with information on the students who copied answers.

      • checkIfStudentIsTheLastOne

        public void checkIfStudentIsTheLastOne()
        Checks if the current student is the last one to submit the test and locks the test if necessary. It retrieves the number of students who have started and finished the test and calculates the difference to determine if the current student is the last one. If the current student is the last one, it sends a message to lock the test.

      • updateAverageAndMedian

        public void updateAverageAndMedian()
        Updates the average and median grades for a specific test code. It retrieves all the student test records for the specified test code, calculates the average and median grades from the list of grades, and updates the median and average values in the test record.

      • getAnswers

        public void getAnswers()
        Retrieves the selected answers from the toggle groups and builds a string representation of the answers. If a toggle group does not have a selected toggle (no answer provided), a "0" is appended to the string. Otherwise, the number associated with the selected toggle is appended.

      • calculateGrade

        public void calculateGrade()
        Calculates the grade for the student based on the selected answers. Iterates over the toggle groups and checks if the user has answered the question. If the user has answered and the selected answer is correct, the corresponding points are added to the grade.

      • testIsSubmit

        public void testIsSubmit​(java.lang.Integer timeOfStudent)
        Submits the test for the student. Updates the necessary data, calculates the grade, inserts the answers and grade into the database, inserts the distribution data, shows an information alert, and redirects to the student menu.
        Parameters:
        timeOfStudent - The time taken by the student to complete the test.

      • testIsLockCantSubmmit

        public void testIsLockCantSubmmit()
        Handles the situation when the test is locked and cannot be submitted. Updates the necessary data, shows an error alert, and inserts the answers and grade into the database. If the flagEndOrMiddle is set to "End", the grade is set to 0.

      • timeOfStudentIsOverLoad

        public void timeOfStudentIsOverLoad()
        Handles the case when the student has exceeded the allowed time for the test.

      • setTextCountdown

        public void setTextCountdown​(java.lang.String countdownText)
        Sets the text of the countdown label to the specified string.
        Specified by:
        setTextCountdown in interface CountDown
        Parameters:
        countdownText - The string to be set as the text of the countdown label.

      • endOfTime

        public void endOfTime()
        Callback method called when the time limit for the student has ended. Performs necessary actions such as notifying the end of time, checking if the student is the last one, and updating the average and median.
        Specified by:
        endOfTime in interface CountDown

      • testGotManualyLockedByLecturer

        public void testGotManualyLockedByLecturer​(java.lang.String testCode)
        Callback method called when the test is manually locked by the lecturer. Checks if the provided test code matches the current test code and displays an error alert. Sets the flag indicating the test is in the middle state and invokes the method to handle a locked test. Finally, updates the average and median.
        Specified by:
        testGotManualyLockedByLecturer in interface Testing
        Parameters:
        testCode - The test code to compare with the current test code.

      • testdurationGotChanged

        public void testdurationGotChanged​(java.lang.String testCode,
                                   java.lang.Integer duration)
        gets a pop message about a change in duration and act properly.
        Specified by:
        testdurationGotChanged in interface Testing
        Parameters:
        testCode - the test code.
        duration - the new duration.
